intro: Galatella malacitana, commonly known as the Malacitana bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Galatella malacitana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and naturalized areas.
